CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 19, 1954, pg. 20, reads: "Steelworker Artist...James E. Morgan St., left, 56, of 154 Mayflower Street, East End, tells Mrs. Anita Morgenstein, and Herbert Weissberger, curator of decorative arts at Carnegie Institute, about his oil painting, 'Our P-TA Convenes,' which this year won for Mr. Morgan his third straight first prize in Everyman's Annual Art Show for Amateur Painters, now being held at the Pittsburgh Arts and Crafts Center, Fifth and Shady Avenues. Mrs. Morgenstein is the art show's exhibition chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: James E. Morgan Sr. standing beside his painting "Our P-TA Convenes," with Herbert Weissberger and Anita Morgenstein on right, in Pittsburgh Center for the Arts
